page.title: 12SWANMORE CLERGY
page.content: {The Vicar of Swanmore interviewed by {Alan:}Mr. Paterson thinks his job is wonderful. He conducts Sunday services, weddings and baptisms and visits the sick. It is a 24 hour day but the Bishop insists that they must have four Sundays off a year and some days after Christmas and Easter. He let me look at his books. He used to be a sailor. He is involved in all sorts of village and Church activities {The Methodist Minister interviewed by {Clare and Emma: }Mr. Barrat looks after six village churches, preaching to about 38 adults each service. He has been a minister for 37 years and enjoys his work. He is on call all the time, but has 48 days' holiday a year. Once he went to a hospital and saw a baby dying. He christened him and he prayed that he would recover and he did.
